alert.note: Alert for Jim Hogg; Northern Hidalgo; Southern Hidalgo; Starr; Zapata (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 2:36AM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ..."FEEL LIKE" TEMPERATURES UP TO 110 DEGREES THIS AFTERNOON... The combination of above average temperatures and high relative humidity values will produce heat indices, or "feel like" temperatures, between 105 and 110 degrees this afternoon across Zapata, Jim Hogg, Starr, and Hidalgo Counties. A few locations along the I-2/US-83 corridor in Hidalgo and Starr Counties may intermittently experience Heat Index values between 111 to 113 degrees for a couple of hours this afternoon. If spending time outside today, drink plenty of water, wear light weight and light colored clothing, and take frequent breaks from the heat. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles. This is especially true during warm or hot weather when car interiors can reach lethal temperatures in minutes.

area.areaDesc: Jim Hogg; Northern Hidalgo; Southern Hidalgo; Starr; Zapata
